N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 594.9 - Residents' rights

State Regulations
(a) The provider of
service shall ensure the provision of notices of recipients' rights described
in section
527.5
of this Title to each
resident and his or her family or significant others. Such notice shall also
address residents' right to wear age-appropriate clothing, receive prompt
medical attention, and have access to appropriate education. (b) Each child or adolescent, family or
significant other shall be apprised of the residence grievance process which
ensures the timely review and resolution of resident's or family's complaints. (1)

The grievance process must ensure an
objective review of the issues, timely resolution and adequate
documentation. (2)

The name and
number of an Office of Mental Health contact person shall be made available to
a resident and/or family member whenever a grievance process cannot be resolved
to the satisfaction of all parties. Within 14 days, the Office of Mental Health
will review the circumstances surrounding the disagreement and make a
recommendation concerning a course of action to be taken. (3)

If successful resolution to the grievance
cannot be achieved through the process delineated in paragraphs (1) and (2) of
this subdivision, the resident and/or family member has a right to legal
recourse and must be provided with information regarding where to obtain legal
assistance including, but not limited to, mental hygiene legal services. The
resident and/or family member should also be informed in writing, that
complaints can be made to the Commission on Quality of Care and Advocacy for

Persons with Disabilities. Notes
